column2: The choice of arms was thine; Yet art thou scoffed at by the crucified! He lives--thy loss.
column3: The choice of arms was thine; Yet art thou scoffed at by the crucified! He lives-thy loss.

column2: These things gave you birth: So have they mind and God.
column3: These things gave you birth: So have they mind and God.

column2: Repent; be wise! Man fights but ill with Him who rules the skies.
column3: Repent; be wise! Man fights but ill with Him who rules the skies.

column2: But my bell hath broke Her silence.
column3: But my bell hath broke Her silence.

column2: Yield, thou deaf, blind, tainted beast, To the wise fervour of a blameless mind!
column3: Yield, thou deaf, blind, tainted beast, To the wise fervour of a blameless mind!

column2: All crime is its own torment, bearing woe To mind or body or decrease of fame; If not at once, still step by step our name Or blood or friends or fortune it brings low. But if our will do not resent the blow, We have not sinned.
column3: All crime is its own torment, bearing woe To mind or body or decrease of fame; If not at once, still step by step our name Or blood or friends or fortune it brings low. But if our will do not resent the blow, We have not sinned.

column2: Organ of rut, not reason, is the lord Who from the body politic doth drain Lust for himself, instead of toil and pain, Leaving us lean as crickets on dry sward. Well too if he like Love would filch our hoard With pleasure to ourselves, sluicing our vein And vigour to perpetuate the strain Of life by spilth of life within us stored! Love's cheat yields joy and profit.
column3: Organ of rut, not reason, is the lord Who from the body politic doth drain Lust for himself, instead of toil and pain, Leaving us lean as crickets on dry sward.
